The question isn't just "will this be exposed?" but "can we afford the consequences if it is?"

That said, your point about the broader consequences deserves serious consideration. If acting immediately leads to layoffs and the supplier simply finds less scrupulous buyers, the net outcome for workers might indeed be worse.

What if we explored a middle approach that addresses your immediate concerns while building in safeguards? For instance, demanding verifiable progress milestones from the supplier while quietly beginning to diversify your supply base - not as an immediate replacement, but as insurance against future disruptions?

What aspects of this situation feel most out of your control right now?
